overview:
## Discussion

You can provide a descriptive name for a geometry object to make managing your scene graph easier. Geometries loaded from a scene file may have names assigned by an artist using a 3D authoring tool. Use the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNSceneSource] class to examine geometries in a scene file without loading its scene graph.

Geometry names are saved when you export a scene to a file using its [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNScene/write(to:options:delegate:progressHandler:)] method. They also appear in the Xcode scene editor.

# name

**Instance Property**

A name associated with the geometry object.

## Declaration

```swift
var name: String? { get set }
```

## Discussion

You can provide a descriptive name for a geometry object to make managing your scene graph easier. Geometries loaded from a scene file may have names assigned by an artist using a 3D authoring tool. Use the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNSceneSource] class to examine geometries in a scene file without loading its scene graph.

Geometry names are saved when you export a scene to a file using its [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNScene/write(to:options:delegate:progressHandler:)] method. They also appear in the Xcode scene editor.

## Managing Geometry Attributes

- **SCNBoundingVolume**: Methods common to the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNNode] and [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNGeometry] classes for measuring location and size.
